title: Error messages are swallowed up
body:
Given I have the following components: ``` javascript ``` When I trigger an error in the Map component the first time it renders, I get a plain old error like this: ``` Uncaught Error: hey ``` But if I trigger it after the component receives new props, I get a more complicated error: ``` Uncaught (in promise) Error: hey at Map.render (webpack:///./leaflet-redux/src/components/Map.js?:220:13) at ReactCompositeComponentMixin._renderValidatedComponentWithoutOwnerOrContext (webpack:///../~/react/lib/ReactCompositeComponent.js?:789:34) at ReactCompositeComponentMixin._renderValidatedComponent (webpack:///../~/react/lib/ReactCompositeComponent.js?:816:14) at ReactPerf.measure.wrapper (webpack:///../~/react/lib/ReactPerf.js?:70:21) at ReactCompositeComponentMixin._updateRenderedComponent (webpack:///../~/react/lib/ReactCompositeComponent.js?:746:36) at ReactCompositeComponentMixin._performComponentUpdate (webpack:///../~/react/lib/ReactCompositeComponent.js?:726:10) at ReactCompositeComponentMixin.updateComponent (webpack:///../~/react/lib/ReactCompositeComponent.js?:642:12) at ReactPerf.measure.wrapper [as updateComponent] (webpack:///../~/react/lib/ReactPerf.js?:70:21) at ReactCompositeComponentMixin.receiveComponent (webpack:///../~/react/lib/ReactCompositeComponent.js?:506:10) at Object.ReactReconciler.receiveComponent (webpack:///../~/react/lib/ReactReconciler.js?:97:22) ``` And when I trigger the same error from a child component's render method, there is no error message at all. The messages thrown from the child components are swallowed up. The render method of Map looks like this: ``` javascript render() { console.count('render') this.children = []; // throw new Error('hey') <--- Plain error if (this.map) { let layerComps = getEnabledComps(); this.children = React.addons.createFragment({layerComps}); // throw new Error('hey') <--- Complicated error }; return
{this.children}
; } ``` And the render() of LeafletLayer looks like this: ``` javascript render() { throw new Error('hey') // <-- Does not raise an error return null } ``` Does anyone have an idea what might be going on? I'm also using React Router and Webpack, but I think this might be a React problem.
